roleset.name: go up incrementally
roleset.note: INCREASE-V NOTES: Let's use EXT for numericals only, otherwise Arg2-MNR: (from increase.01-v)
INCREASE-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry increase.01, OntoNotes sense grouping increase.01; maps to VN entries cos-45.4 and calibratable_cos-45.6-1. Framed by Claire. (from increase.01-n)

roles.note: Use argM-ext for mentions of extent of increase. (from increase.01-n)

role.descr: amount increased by, EXT or MNR

example.name: agentive, with end point
example.text: Faulding increased its interest to 70% of Moleculon's stock.

example.name: agentive, with extent
example.text: The Polish government increased home electricity charges by 150%.

example.name: ergative, with extent and end point
example.text: The nation's exports increased 4% to $50.45 billion.

example.name: ergative, with start and end points
example.text: Net income increased to $274 million from $130 million.

example.name: locative
example.text: ...a hit wine dramatically increase in price

example.name: temporal
example.text: Georgia Gulf stock increased $1.75 a share yesterday

example.name: with purpose clause
example.text: Mr. Martin increased prices on some wines just to slow down movement.

example.name: NP only
example.text: a 3.1 % increase in revenue to $ 992.7 million from $ 963 milliona year earlier

example.name: Non-numerical extent, NP only
example.text: `` a very meaningful '' increase in operating profit by Colgate's U.S. business

example.name: Agricultural domain, body part attribute.
example.text: They recorded the cattle's increase in weight over a period of weeks.

example.name: Typical example
example.text: These recent increases in the price of oil have impacted the markets.
